snippet: North Korea responded angrily to a decision to impose tightened sanctions, saying it was nullifying all nonaggression agreements with South Korea.
abstract: Governments of North and South Korea escalate hostile warnings to highest level in years, with each threatening to annihilate the other a day after UN Security Council imposed tightened sanctions on North for latest nuclear test; North also nullifies all nonaggression agreements with South.

byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York, Thom Shanker from Kabul, Afghanistan, and David E. Sanger from Washington.

lead_paragraph: North Korea responded angrily to a decision to impose tightened sanctions, saying it was nullifying all nonaggression agreements with South Korea.

headline.seo: Two Koreas in Doomsday Verbal Exchange After Sanctions Vote
headline.main: After U.N. Vote on Sanctions, 2 Koreas Ratchet Up Threats
headline.print_headline: Two Koreas in Doomsday Threats After Vote at U.N.
